schema.title: SeismicAcquisitionProject
schema.description: A seismic acquistion project is a type of business project that deploys resources to the field to record seismic data.  It may be referred to as a survey or program.  It is not the same as the geometry of the deployed equipment (nav), which is a work product component.

ResourceTypeID.description: The SRN of the resource's resource type.

ResourceID.description: The SRN which identifies this OSDU resource object at the version level.

ResourceHomeRegionID.description: The name of the home [cloud environment] region for this OSDU resource object.

ResourceHostRegionIDs.description: The name of the host [cloud environment] region(s) for this OSDU resource object.

ResourceObjectCreationDateTime.description: Timestamp of the time at which Version 1 of this OSDU resource object was originated.

ResourceVersionCreationDateTime.description: Timestamp of the time when the current version of this resource entered the OSDU.

ResourceCurationStatus.description: Describes the current Curation status. Possible values - CREATED, CURATING, CURATED.

ResourceLifecycleStatus.description: Describes the current Resource Lifecycle status. Possible values - LOADING, RECIEVED, ACCEPTED, RESCINDED, DELETED,

ResourceSecurityClassification.description: Classifies the security level of the resourcse. Possible values = RESTRICTED, CLASSIFIED, CONFIDENTIAL, MOST CONFIDENTIAL

SeismicGeometryTypeID.description: Reference to the standard values for the general layout of the acquisition.  This is an hierarchical value.  The top value is like 2D, 3D, 4D, Borehole, Passive.  The second value is like NATS, WATS, Brick, Crosswell.  Nodes are separated by forward slash.

AreaCalculated.description: The calculated are covered by the survey. This value is calculated during the loading of the survey.

AreaNominal.description: The nominal area covered by the survey. This value is usually entered by the end user.

ShotpointIncrementDistanceUOM.description: Unit of measure for shotpoint increment

EnergySourceTypeID.description: Seismic Source type. E.g.: Airgun, Vibroseis, Dynamite,Watergun

SourceArraySeparationDistanceUOM.description: Unit of measure for energy source array seperation

SampleInterval.description: Vertical sampling interval of data at time of acquisition

RecordLength.description: Length of record at time of acquisition

RecordLengthUOM.description: Unit of measure for record length

ShootingAzimuthAngle.description: Orientation of plane between source and recievers.

ShootingAzimuthAngleUOM.description: Unit of measure for shooting azimuth

CableLengthUOM.description: Unit of measure for cable length

CableSpacingDistanceUOM.description: Unit of measure for cable spacing

MinOffsetDistance.description: Horizontal distance between source and first reciever

MinOffsetDistanceUOM.description: Unit of measure for min offset

MaxOffsetDistance.description: Horizontal distance between source and last reciever

MaxOffsetDistanceUOM.description: Unit of measure for max offset

FoldCount.description: The number of times a point in the subsurface is sampled.  It measures of the redundancy of common midpoint seismic data
